name: arcaded
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a covered area or passage that is joined to a building on one side, often supported by columns on the other side: The rooms of the villa are simply arranged around a large, arcaded courtyard. The street was shadily arcaded on either side.
More examplesFewer examplesSome of the shops still have the original arcaded windows.The piazza is approached from the south by the gracious, arcaded Via Roma. The restaurant is a very enjoyable place to eat, with a fountain and an arcaded terrace.The sides of the building are fenced with grilles of delicate metalwork and its upper storey is graciously arcaded.
